bonzai.api

Class Node

  • java.lang.Object
    • bonzai.api.Node

  • public class Node
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that describes a node with the information known to a given team. A Node is the location that Actors can reside on.
    Author:
    Austin

    • Method Detail

      • getX

        public int getX()
        Get the grid x position.
        Returns:
        Node x position.

      • getY

        public int getY()
        Get the grid y position
        y = 0 is on the top of the map and increases as you move down.
        Returns:
        Node y position.

      • getActors

        public java.util.ArrayList<Actor> getActors()
        Return the list of actors on the node.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of actors or an empty ArrayList of actors if node is not visible.

      • isNaturalWall

        public boolean isNaturalWall()
        Checks to see if this node is a natural wall (a wall that is a feature of the map).
        Returns:
        True if the node is a natural wall only, and does not account for blocker made walls.

      • isPassable

        public boolean isPassable()
        Determine if the node is known to be traversable.
        Returns:
        False if the node is either a natural wall, or a visibly blocked node. Note that if the node has an unseen blocking blocker, this will still return true.

      • isBase

        public boolean isBase()
        Checks to see if this node is a base node.
        Returns:
        True if this is a base node.

      • isVisible

        public boolean isVisible()
        Checks to see if this Node is visible.
        Returns:
        True if the node is visible.

      • getNearby

        public Node getNearby(int dir)
        Gets a node in a certain direction.
        Parameters:
        dir - : the direction (Node.UP, Node.DOWN...)
        Returns:
        The node in that direction or null if there is no node in that direction.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Returns true if the provided object is a node with the same coordinates as this one.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        o - Object to test against
        Returns:

        Returns a string containing formatted x,y coordinates for easy printing.
